title: (x) Detroit Red Wings - Belwe, Bookman Swash {Eduardo, Dan}
author: cph

comments.content: oh sorry, this look like TANGO
the 2nd one is close to jukebox cabernet, but it isnt - but i've seen this one before ... lemme think... lars
The bottom one is Bookman Swash.

\>_I noticed none of the weights has this sloping_   
\>_e-bar. Is this a specific feature of the Swash_   
\>_variant, or do you think they rotated it?_   
   
I recall that the photofilm version of ITC Bookman had several alternates, aside from the Swash. I'll check my Phil
ITC Bookman Demi and Bold with swashes, alternates and OSF. Love that

I was hesitating to say that, because the sample looks   
rounder and there are some idiosyncracies. It clearly   
bears Benguiat's signature, that's for sure. When I   
checked ITC Bookman, I noticed none of the weights   
has this sloping e-bar. Is this a specific feature of the   
Swash variant, or do you think they rotated it?
